intro: Phlox austromontana subsp. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow phlox, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern South America. It is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its vibrant floral display and adaptability to cooler climates contribute to its horticultural appeal.
